skillPacks.proposalLink: 1. Animation Program Modification New Model (Revised) FALL 2025
skillPacks.description: The Foundation Skill Pack offers a thorough exploration of visual development and compositing artistry, encompassing critical techniques in figure drawing, concept art creation, and 3D animation compositing. Students commence with figure drawing fundamentals, familiarizing themselves with human anatomy, proportion, and gesture to build strong observational skills. In the Concept Art segment, students develop compelling visual narratives and character designs, emphasizing ideation, principles of design, and professional presentation techniques. The course culminates with compositing for 3D animation, where students acquire technical integration and artistic enhancement workflows, enabling them to produce polished, production-quality final compositions.

courses.prerequisites: Game Art, Animation majors or ART-110

skillPacks.proposalLink: 1. Animation Program Modification New Model (Revised) FALL 2025
skillPacks.description: Students will create 2D and 3D animated characters and assets by applying core animation principles, modeling and texturing techniques, and industry-standard workflows, gaining hands-on experience in storytelling, motion, and professional production processes.

courses.prerequisites: None Animation and Game Art students priority
None Animation and Game Art students priority

skillPacks.proposalLink: 1. Animation Program Modification New Model (Revised) FALL 2025
skillPacks.description: This three-course sequence guides students through a progressive journey in animation production, moving from exploratory learning to professional-level execution. Beginning with fundamental research and technique acquisition across the complete pipeline, from storyboarding and concept design through character animation, rigging, and post-production, students build core competencies through experimental projects. The sequence then advances to discovering specialized tools and advanced methodologies, where students identify opportunities to refine their craft and develop a distinctive creative voice. Finally, students synthesize their knowledge in a capstone production experience, creating industry-standard animation work that demonstrates mastery of collaboration, workflow management, and technical excellence across all production stages. This progression prepares students for seamless integration into professional animation studio environments.

skillPacks.proposalLink: 1. Animation Program Modification New Model (Revised) FALL 2025
skillPacks.description: The VFX Compositing Skill Pack provides students with the expertise to integrate digital elements seamlessly into live-action and CG environments. Starting with compositing for 3D Animation, students learn industry-standard techniques for layering, color correction, keying, and visual integration using professional node based compositing software. In VFX Animation, they explore motion graphics, particle effects, and dynamic simulations to create stunning visual effects. Finally, Real-Time Animation introduces cutting-edge workflows for generating high-quality VFX in game engines and virtual production environments.

courses.prerequisites: Animation & Game Art, film, 90 credits complete

skillPacks.proposalLink: 1. Animation Program Modification New Model (Revised) FALL 2025
skillPacks.description: The Modeling Skill Pack offers a thorough and foundational exploration of 3D asset creation, encompassing critical techniques in modeling, texturing, character development, and rendering. Students commence with an introductory focus on modeling and texturing, where they familiarize themselves with essential workflows for constructing and surfacing 3D objects. In the Character Modeling segment, students refine their craft by sculpting and optimizing detailed, animation-ready characters, with a particular emphasis on anatomical accuracy and topology. The course culminates with a study of 3D lighting and rendering, where students acquire knowledge in both artistic and cinematic lighting techniques, enabling them to produce visually compelling, production-quality renders.

courses.prerequisites: C or better in MOD 100 - 3D Modeling & Texturing Foundation
Animation & Game Art, film, 90 credits completed

skillPacks.proposalLink: 1. Animation Program Modification New Model (Revised) FALL 2025
skillPacks.description: The 2D Animation Skill Pack provides students with the core competencies necessary to effectively convey narratives through dynamic and expressive animation. The course begins with Storyboarding, where students acquire proficiency in visual storytelling, shot composition, and sequencing, enabling them to construct cohesive and compelling narrative frameworks. In the 2D Animation Principles segment, students develop a strong grasp of fundamental animation concepts, including timing, spacing, weight, and movement, applying industry-standard methodologies to create believable and fluid motion. The final stage, 2D Advanced Animation, challenges students to refine their craft through complex motion, character acting, storytelling, culminating in the creation of polished, industry-ready animations.

courses.prerequisites: C or better in ANM 200 - 2D Animation Principles
Animation & Game Art, film, 90 credits completed

courses.courseTitle: 2D Animation Rigging and VFX (Elective, not required)

skillPacks.proposalLink: Applied Mathematics B.S. - Program Modification - New Model 2025 (version 3.0)
skillPacks.description: This skill pack equips students with tools for modeling and interpreting continuous systems—how things change, move, grow, and accumulate. Beyond mastering derivatives and integrals, students learn to analyze multi-dimensional systems and draw conclusions from complex functions that appear in physics, biology, economics, and beyond.

skillPacks.proposalLink: Applied Mathematics B.S. - Program Modification - New Model 2025 (version 3.0)
skillPacks.description: This pack focuses on the non-continuous side of mathematics, where reasoning, structure, and order matter most. Students explore systems made of discrete parts: logic, graphs, algorithms, matrices, and abstract geometry. This pack is foundational for students entering computing, cryptography, education, and any domain requiring precision and abstract thinking.

skillPacks.proposalLink: Applied Mathematics B.S. - Program Modification - New Model 2025 (version 3.0)
skillPacks.description: This skill pack develops the ability to translate mathematical problems into computational processes. Students learn how algorithms, iteration, and approximation can solve problems beyond the reach of exact methods. It's a bridge between pure math and practical application—critical for work in engineering, science, and data modeling.

skillPacks.skillPackTitle: Sustainability Policy, Justice and Action: Places and People
skillPacks.proposalLink: Applied Sustainability Program Modification - New Academic Model - Spring 2025
skillPacks.description: Students will actively engage in projects which integrate knowledge of environmental policy, sustainable development through project-based learning and begin to serve in an active role in shaping a more equitable and sustainable future using data, professional methodologies and fieldwork skills.

skillPacks.proposalLink: Applied Sustainability Program Modification - New Academic Model - Spring 2025
skillPacks.description: Through scientific method, practice and application, students will use scientific discovery to understand the role of human influence in ecosystems and wildlife conservation, promote ethical and equitable conservation practices and present scientific findings and ecological research in clear, effective written and oral formats, targeted to diverse audiences including policymakers, stakeholders, and the general public.

skillPacks.programName: Business Administration BSBA, Game Business & Publishing, Game Production Management

skillPacks.description: These courses provide a comprehensive foundation in business by fostering an entrepreneurial mindset, developing human-centered leadership skills, and applying core marketing principles to create ethical and market-driven solutions in real-world contexts.

courses.courseTitle: Financial Concepts for Organizations OR Financial Language of Business

skillPacks.proposalLink: BSBA - Program Modification - New Model Spring 2025 rev2025-09

skillPacks.proposalLink: CNCS B.S. Program Modification New Model Spring 2025
skillPacks.description: This skillpack introduces foundational concepts in systems, networking, and cybersecurity, providing the building blocks for a career in cybersecurity.

skillPacks.proposalLink: CNCS B.S. Program Modification New Model Spring 2025
skillPacks.description: Students will develop skills in network implementations, system administration, and enterprise-level infrastructure management, enabling them to configure, troubleshoot, and secure complex IT systems in professional settings.

skillPacks.description: This skillpack focuses on advanced system administration, scripting, automation, and securing web systems to meet modern cybersecurity challenges

skillPacks.proposalLink: CNCS B.S. Program Modification New Model Spring 2025
skillPacks.description: This skillpack provides expertise in securing enterprise environments through threat hunting, information assurance, and implementing robust security controls.

skillPacks.proposalLink: Digital Forensics Program Modification New Model Spring 2025
skillPacks.description: Equips students with a comprehensive foundation in digital forensics, covering evidence identification, preservation, analysis, and reporting across key domains, including civil and criminal investigations, Windows artifact analysis, and mobile device forensics. Students will use industry-standard tools and forensic methodologies to interpret digital evidence, reconstruct system activity, and produce detailed investigative reports.

skillPacks.proposalLink: Digital Forensics Program Modification New Model Spring 2025
skillPacks.description: This skill pack integrates advanced cybersecurity risk management and defense strategies with comprehensive digital forensic techniques, enabling students to analyze operating system artifacts across Linux, Mac, and Windows to reconstruct digital timelines, while also developing expertise in malware behavior analysis, detection evasion, and incident response.

skillPacks.skillPackTitle: Enterprise Digital Forensics and Threat Hunting
skillPacks.proposalLink: Digital Forensics Program Modification New Model Spring 2025
skillPacks.description: This skill pack integrates comprehensive digital forensics competencies, combining the analysis of disks, volumes, and file systems with practical, real-world case investigations and network forensics techniques for threat detection and mitigation.

courses.prerequisites: FOR-230 or any intro level programming class (CSI-1xx)

skillPacks.description: Students will be able to articulate and apply various creative methods as they pertain to artistic inquiry and artistic production. Methods to include processes and techniques such as ideation, iteration, critique, chance operations and working in series, as well as lenses such as media specificity, genre awareness, body of work.

skillPacks.description: This skillpack provides a grounding in art and media analysis through theoretical, critical and ethical approaches to art and aesthetics. Questions explored include: How have the creations of artists and media makers shaped the culture in which we live? How do the narratives, images, and experiences of fine art and popular media help us understand, describe and interpret the world? What opportunities are there today for artists to make an impact and contribute to social discourse?

skillPacks.description: Students will analyze sociological theories and case studies of deviance and crime, critique media portrayals of crime, and compare global social control systems through case studies, media analysis, and cross-cultural research.

skillPacks.description: Students will examine theories of behavior labeled in the U.S. as “criminal,” crime patterns, victim experiences, and justice system responses by applying criminological theories, conducting research, and analyzing crime data using real-world case studies and statistical methods.

Students will analyze legal principles, investigative techniques, and procedural rules related to technology-facilitated crimes, focusing on criminal law, digital evidence collection, and white-collar crime investigations.

Students understand the development and launch of video games within the context of the industry as it stands today. This includes the business of researching, planning for, marketing, launching and maintaining a game, including in international contexts. They also are exposed to many current events within the industry.

skillPacks.description: Students develop multimedia content creation abilities, digital marketing implementation skills, and understanding of emerging practices through hands-on projects that apply across diverse fields including media, design, business, and nonprofit organizations.

courses.prerequisites: 90 credits completed – recommend changing to 72 credits

skillPacks.proposalLink: Psychology B.S. Program Modification_v3
skillPacks.description: This pack introduces students to the scientific foundations of psychology, human development across the lifespan, and the cognitive processes underlying learning, memory, and problem-solving. Students gain the theoretical and analytical grounding necessary for advanced study and applied work.

skillPacks.proposalLink: Psychology B.S. Program Modification_v3
skillPacks.description: This skillpack explores creativity, cultural perspectives, and applied decision-making. Students learn how imagination and play fuel innovation, how cultural identity shapes behavior, and how individuals and groups make choices in uncertain contexts.

skillPacks.proposalLink: Psychology B.S. Program Modification_v3
skillPacks.description: This skillpack explores the factors shaping individual and group behavior in social, technological, and organizational contexts. Students explore social influence, persuasion, group dynamics, media effects, consumer behavior, and organizational dynamics, learning to apply psychology to practical problems in social, technological, business, media, and design environments. Applications include everyday social influence, marketing and organizational contexts, and forensic psychology scenarios, such as jury decision-making, eyewitness testimony, and behavioral analysis in legal settings.

skillPacks.proposalLink: Psychology B.S. Program Modification_v3
skillPacks.description: This skill pack provides students with a comprehensive foundation in research methodology, from fundamental principles and hands-on application of qualitative and quantitative research methods to conducting independent research and applying psychological theories through statistical analysis.

courses.prerequisites: 24 completed credits and MTH-180 co-requisite or prerequisite

skillPacks.proposalLink: Social Work Program Modification New Model Fall 2025
skillPacks.description: Through direct engagement with community partners and investigation of societal and community-based responses to complex human needs, students will gain experience serving within the expansive systems of care network, engage with community partners, critically evaluate practices at the societal level and hone skills to serve in leadership roles to effectively lead group-based interventions.

skillPacks.proposalLink: Social Work Program Modification New Model Fall 2025
skillPacks.description: Through hands-on shared projects aligned with current needs in the broader community students will engage in practices of applied solidarity towards social and liberatory action collaborating or initiating actionable change efforts.

skillPacks.proposalLink: Social Work Program Modification New Model Fall 2025
skillPacks.description: Students will gain theoretical knowledge of the human experience, human development to practice effective professional interventions to impact positive growth at the individual, group and community levels.

courses.courseTitle: Practice Skills 1: Needs Assessment & Relationship Building

skillPacks.skillPackTitle: Social Determinants of Health and Wellness
skillPacks.proposalLink: Social Work Program Modification New Model Fall 2025
skillPacks.description: Students will gain knowledge about diverse life experiences with sensitivity to cultural, ethical, and systemic factors affecting health and well-being and apply an understanding of the Social Determinants of Health to promote self-determination among individuals, using harm reduction strategies, restorative practices, interdisciplinary care networks, public health campaigns and natural support systems.

skillPacks.proposalLink: Sonic Arts B.S. - Program Modification - New Model 2026
skillPacks.description: Students will investigate and gain experience in multiple aspects of music-making, including theory, composition, history, and recording/production in both digital and analog workflows.

skillPacks.proposalLink: Sonic Arts B.S. - Program Modification - New Model 2026
skillPacks.description: Students create music, sound effects, and other audio assets using a variety of techniques both in and out of the computer.

skillPacks.proposalLink: Sonic Arts B.S. - Program Modification - New Model 2026
Revised Writing & Publishing: Program Modification New Model Fall 2025
skillPacks.description: Sequence of courses that will introduce students to the foundational skills associated with Writing and Publishing, with emphasis on 3 core skill sets: writing, reading, and editing / publishing.

skillPacks.proposalLink: Revised Writing & Publishing: Program Modification New Model Fall 2025
skillPacks.description: This series immerses students in diverse and evolving literary genres through advanced workshops. Students will deepen their writing practice by working on more advanced, customizable projects and will explore the history of and social implications of stories that extend across different genres and forms.

skillPacks.skillPackTitle: The Collaborative Craft of Writing & Publishing
skillPacks.proposalLink: Revised Writing & Publishing: Program Modification New Model Fall 2025
skillPacks.description: Optional skillpack for Writing & Publishing students that will focus on professionalization and job preparation for careers in the publishing industry (i.e. editing, publishing, networking, professional collaboration, etc.)

metadata.description: Required Program Skill Packs organized by program and skill pack type
